revised_title: Detection and Measurement of Overlapping Fatigue Cracks in Welded Joints
tldr: This article presents a study on the detection and measurement of overlapping fatigue cracks at welded joints using thin-skin electromagnetic fields. The authors calculate the characteristic responses of overlapping cracks for the alternating-current field-measurement method and compare them with experimental data. The results show that overlapping cracks produce asymmetric cross-crack signal profiles and characteristic changes in curvature, which can be used to find the positions of the crack ends.
scientific_discipline: Engineering and Technology > Materials Science and Engineering
